abstract: Some employment and antitrust lawyers claim that there is an unwritten agreement among the major technology companies not to poach employees from one other.
snippet: Some employment and antitrust lawyers claim that there is an unwritten agreement among the major technology companies not to poach employees from one other.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Silicon Valley was abuzz Wednesday with news that the Justice Department had begun an antitrust investigation into the hiring practices of some of the best-known companies in the technology and biotech industries, including Google, Apple, Yahoo and Genentech.

headline.main: Unwritten Code Rules Silicon Valley Hiring
headline.print_headline: Unwritten Code Rules Silicon Valley Hiring

abstract: As the Justice Department probes into the hiring practices of some of the best-known tech companies, some experts said that while companies do compete for talent, it is not a free-for-all.
snippet: As the Justice Department probes into the hiring practices of some of the best-known tech companies, some experts said that while companies do compete for talent, it is not a free-for-all.
lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley was abuzz Wednesday with news that the Justice Department had begun an antitrust investigation into the hiring practices of some of the best-known companies in the technology and biotech industries, including Google, Apple, Yahoo and Genentech.

headline.main: Unwritten Code Rules Hiring in Silicon Valley
